comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: A similar view in the 1880s before the construction. From State Library of NSW: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413130

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] I gave up trying to match it with Googlemaps, I presume we are looking west with Circular Quay off screen on our right? What is the church in the background?

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/highranger]  Yes Circular Quay is to right, and the church is St Phillips on Church Hill.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/highranger] Yes, StreetView is no good here - there is an enormous tower in the way. From Phillip Street looking west (see notes). I think they were building the Metropole Hotel which opened in January 1890 - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362674751/] The Grosvenor Hotel (at the top, see note) opened in November 1888 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/28339993 - and shows up on the skyline of many old photos. Demolished in 1928 to make way for the Harbour Bridge, but possibly rebuilt as flats in Randwick according to this - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16478518 - anyone know for sure? Which dates this photo to 1888, as it would have taken a while to complete the Metropole Hotel. Or not?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Top half of sign is legible on our larger version:

"This site will shortly be occupied
by a large coffee palace
capable of accommodating 300 visitors.
?? Coffee Tavern..."

AB

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] The Hotel Metropole, under construction here, was built for the Australian Coffee Palace Company, who constructed similar buildings in Sydney, Melbourne and elsewhere, with the temperance aim of providing an alternative to 'the demon drink'. See: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coffee_palace

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Thanks,  that's interesting.  I thought previously that Coffee Palace was a brand name,  like Starbucks.  Oops!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I love the free range chooks!

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] haha! I didn't notice those, It reminds me of this time 3 yrs ago bringing 9 x 2 day old chicks to our Pitt Street office as I cannot run an incubator at home. I parked at QVB carpark,  and carried them across George Street then through the Hilton Hotel in a cat box. The expressions on peoples faces that day were priceless.
Now they are all grown up I should let them out at Cnr of Bent and Young Streets to restore the scene back to the way it was (at least in terms of chooks)
